Topic.Title: Playing Quest in Browser, when built game in Desktop Version

Posts.EditableText:
Hi,

I have a partially built game that a few friends of mine wants to test. Some of them have been able to do so, as they can just download the desktop version as they have windows. But a few have Linux and can't use the desktop version to play the game. 

It says on the site that you CAN play it in a browser... but I don't know how you do so. How do you do so?

Any help would be appreciated.
Posts.HTML:
Hi,

I have a partially built game that a few friends of mine wants to test. Some of them have been able to do so, as they can just download the desktop version as they have windows. But a few have Linux and can't use the desktop version to play the game.

It says on the site that you CAN play it in a browser... but I don't know how you do so. How do you do so?

Any help would be appreciated.

Posts.EditableText:
you can play games online (on quest's servers), so, you'd need to publish/upload your game file, and then provide the link for your friends to play it.

http://textadventures.co.uk/submit/submitfile (upload game link)

http://textadventures.co.uk (playing a game link)
Posts.HTML:

Posts.EditableText:
Question: How long does it take for moderators to take a look at it? 

I uploaded it at about 3pm my timezone and its about 10pm my timezone and every time I go to "launch the game" it says "Loading" at the top and stays like that for well over a minute (its only about 100kb in size so I doubt its bandwidth related)
